image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: In the midst of the tobacco wars, Victoria Police asked the government to make it harder for accused arsonists to get bail, but its requests were mostly refused, secret documents show.

title.children: Police want bail crackdown on tobacco arsonists, FOI documents show

image.altText: Man with black hair holding football, leaning over a white picket fence.

props.synopsis: Jeremy Rodi would forget how he spent the day before seeking treatment for concussion. Now a treatment clinic has opened in his home town of Bendigo in regional Victoria.

title.children: Country footballers desperate for concussion treatment book out clinic

image.altText: Headshot of Joseph William Dare.

props.synopsis: A Colac district farmer and former AFL-listed player has been fined $75,000 and banned from cattle farming for 10 years after pleading guilty to extensive animal cruelty.

title.children: Farmer and former AFL draftee Joseph Dare banned from owning cattle

image.altText: A drone photo taken from above a beach wall at Frankston South

props.synopsis: As sea level rises threaten coastal infrastructure, erosion is becoming a growing threat for communities across Australia.

title.children: Building individual seawalls 'doubles the erosion next door', experts say

image.altText: A female with brown hair looks down at a wire with a branch wrapped around it.

props.synopsis: Ballooning water prices in Australia's largest wine grape growing region are pushing farmers to the brink amid a global oversupply of some wines and ongoing drought in southern Australia.

title.children: 'We're at breaking point': Drought and soaring water prices push wine grape growers to exit

image.altText: Riak Andrew wears a Sydney Swans cap in training

props.synopsis: Sydney says youngster Riak Andrew is 'remorseful' after he was cited for using a homophobic slur while playing for the club's VFL side.

title.children: Swan becomes latest AFL player cited over homophobic slur

image.altText: Two boards at the corner of road intersection, a big purple one with West Sale Airport name, on the left a directions board

props.synopsis: An experienced pilot has escaped injury after a landing gear malfunction forced him to make an emergency landing at a Gippsland airport.

title.children: Pilot escapes injury after crash landing at regional airport

image.altText: A caucasian woman with black hair and wearing red lipstick smiles

props.synopsis: A $500,000 reward has been offered for information relating to a fatal house fire in Melbourne's west which killed 27-year-old Katie Tangey.

title.children: Tobacco kingpin named in investigation into fire that killed 27yo

image.altText: Electronic instruments mounted on a pole, in the rain.

props.synopsis: A new weather station at Mansfield in north-east Victoria could close a critical forecasting gap, offering residents more accurate data for the first time.

title.children: Town sick of unreliable BOM forecasts installs own weather station

image.altText: Two elderly women stand together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Wendy Pope and Esme Rash, both in their 90s, have remained firm friends for more than four decades.

title.children: 40-year friendship endures amid love, loss and service

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears serious, standing inside.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan's government has defied a deadline set by Victoria's parliament to publish documents detailing the state's childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian childcare crisis data remains secret after missed deadline

image.altText: The wooden baptist church, photographed under cloudy, overcast skies.

props.synopsis: Mushroom lunch survivor and pastor Ian Wilkinson has made his return to the Korumburra Baptist Church for the first time since Erin Patterson was convicted of murdering his wife.

title.children: Mushroom lunch survivor returns to church after Patterson guilty verdict

image.altText: Two women embrace in a cemetery.

props.synopsis: Funeral photography is about capturing a family's story and emotions while farewelling a loved one.

title.children: Meet the photographers capturing the 'pure emotions' of funerals

image.altText: A house with a police car and police officer standing out the front.

props.synopsis: A man has died after being arrested by police in Traralgon, south-east of Melbourne overnight.

title.children: Investigation launched into man's death after arrest in Victorian town

image.altText: Two men holding jersey

props.synopsis: Zdravko "Zed" Biliic is remembered at a special game of soccer at Albert Park in Melbourne.

title.children: Soccer match honours Zdravko Bilic after shock death

image.altText: A blonde woman standing next to a man seated on a stage wearing a cap

props.synopsis: The academic future of dozens of elite performance students is in doubt after Virtual School Victoria tightened its enrolment criteria for 2026.

title.children: 'Enrolment crisis' for performing arts students at virtual school

image.altText: A man with a mullet and a white singlet top

props.synopsis: From start to finish the Lachlan Young trial for the alleged murder of Hannah McGuire was riddled with twists and turns. A look back on a turbulent eight days in court.

title.children: The courtroom drama of Lachlan Young's murder trial

image.altText: A billabong of water sits inbetween rows of River Red Gum trees.

props.synopsis: The First Peoples of the Millewa-Mallee in Victoria have been awarded native title status with exclusive rights, meaning other people will need their permission to access some designated areas.

title.children: Historic native title ruling gives traditional owners exclusive rights

image.altText: Crops growing on a farm on a sunny day in winter

props.synopsis: Rain brings some relief to drought-affected farmers in Victoria, but most of the state is still desperately dry.

title.children: Crops on a 'knife edge' in Victoria as drought continues to bite

image.altText: Meena Singh stands in an office and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Victoria's children's commissioner has conceded "no-one" is overseeing key decisions of her office after revelations it failed to act on red flags raised about accused child abuser Joshua Brown.

title.children: 'No-one' overseeing key decisions, concedes Victoria's children's commissioner

image.altText: Dark grapes on a vine.

props.synopsis: A Victorian wine producer has cut his chemical usage after growing grapes resistant to disease.

title.children: Grape grower cuts out the chemicals to stand out in tight market

image.altText: Four white mushrooms with blue parasol-shaped heads.

props.synopsis: A mysterious world of colourful toadstools, ghostly mushrooms and bizarre white "cages" has emerged from the gloom.

title.children: Wonderland of native fungi springs to life during winter

image.altText: A man wearing a blue top and jeans and a woman in a red coat entering Walpole Hall alongside a door with a 'polling place' sign

props.synopsis: Independent MP for Kooyong Monique Ryan vows to introduce a bill to parliament aimed at lowering the minimum voting age, after the UK decided to reduce its voting age from 18 to 16.

title.children: Independent MP to push for lowering of Australian voting age

image.altText: The Thing, Vanessa Kirby as Sue Storm, Pedro Pascal as Mister Fantastic, and Joseph Quinn as Human Torch stand on a platform.

props.synopsis: No movie franchise has repeatedly crashed and burned quite like Marvel's Fantastic Four. So why is another film coming out?

title.children: Will it be fifth time lucky for the Fantastic Four?

image.altText: GettyImages-2222701381

props.synopsis: St Kilda coach Ross Lyon hits out at racist online trolls as the Saints prepare to face the Cats at Kardinia Park.

title.children: 'It was hate, it was vehement': Saints coach hits out at racist trolls

image.altText: Smoke and flames are seen billowing from a house on fire

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with two counts of attempted murder after a fire in Melbourne's south-east left her and two children in a critical condition.

title.children: Woman appears in court on attempted murder charges of girls in house fire

image.altText: Zach Merrett leads Essendon players onto the ground

props.synopsis: Essendon has been hit with an injury toll that has rarely been seen in professional sports. ABC Sport spoke to a physiotherapist to help gain an understanding of the various factors that result in professional athletes getting hurt.

title.children: As Bombers battle injury bug, these silent factors lead to athletes getting hurt

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short, white hair looks angry as he stands outdoors on a grey day.

props.synopsis: A furious Victorian mayor says it is "disgraceful" that the EPA monitored toxic waste being dumped on council land for years only to leave ratepayers to foot the $500,000 clean-up bill.

title.children: Council faces $500k toxic waste clean-up EPA watched happen, mayor says

image.altText: Two women with arms on their hips in a large hall, some dancers hang around a stage

props.synopsis: Three of Ukraine's most celebrated dancers have travelled from war-torn Kyiv to Australia to conduct a week-long traditional dance masterclass.

title.children: Honoured Ukrainian dancers 'pass legacy on' as war continues

image.altText: A swift parrot perching on a branch

props.synopsis: A gathering of close to the total estimated population of swift parrots excites ecologists, but they warn it is no party for the critically endangered species.

title.children: Massive flock of critically endangered swift parrots seen in one spot

image.altText: A close-up shot of a newborn baby's hand inside an adult hand.

props.synopsis: Researchers in the United Kingdom have announced the successful birth of eight babies after a clinical trial of an IVF technique known as mitochondrial donation.

title.children: What is mitochondrial donation and why is it called 'three-person IVF'?

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The aviation sector was home to two of the nation’s most high-profile murderers, however documents reveal Airservices Australia and CASA have not reviewed their systems of psychometric testing.

title.children: Little discussion of high-profile murders at CASA, Airservices Australia

image.altText: The mangled remains of a vehicle near an SUV and a ute, also seriously damaged, on a road. Emergency personnel are nearby.

props.synopsis: Victorian man Peter Agius sent and received more than 80 Snapchat messages in the lead-up to the 2023 crash that killed Adam Sutton, who had just picked his son up from his first day of school.

title.children: Jail for Snapchatting driver who killed young dad, gave 6yo brain damage

image.altText: large graffiti letters on a rock wall

props.synopsis: Two men are arrested and one is charged, after the discovery of a 10-metre piece of vandalism on a rock face on Taungurung Country in Victoria's Alpine National Park.

title.children: Two men arrested after graffiti found at culturally significant site

image.altText: A group of GWS players surround a smiling forward after he has kicked a goal.

props.synopsis: The Bombers finish strongly to stop GWS clinching a big percentage boost, but the Giants enter the top four as Jake Stringer has a big night against his old club.

title.children: GWS crack top four as Jake Stringer has big night against old club Bombers
